answers.answer: i hve pcos aswell and was tryin for 4yrs gt preg bt unfortunately miscarried at 6wks :( i carried on n now im nearly 26wks with a lil girl :) my midwife put me as high risk due to pcos n past history but so far ive hd a great pregnancy x

I have PCOS and tried for five years to get pregnant. We have finally succeeded and I am 23 weeks with a little girl. I am considered high risk but I also have other medical issues. There haven't been any problems in my pregnancy, either. Good luck and don't worry.

I have pcos,,before my pcos I had 2 regular..normal pregnancies..this is my 3rd n it's been a lil hard I had to have a cerclage. But after being put on bed rest i'm 31+2 with a healthy boy. I feel that me knowing everything I can about my pcos keeps me on point with my pregnancy..it was hard conceiving but I took it easy n any little thing that was wrong I called my Dr

I have pcos too and conceived after losing 2 1/2 stone with a lot of effort. The only thing my midwife said is they need to check me for gestational diabetes, i think the pcos gives u a higher chance of getting it during pregnancy. I dont think theres any other risks though...not that ive heard x

question: I have Pcos. And we have been trying for nearly 3 Years to get pregnant. And we have finally succeeded. I was just wondering if anybody knew if this pregnancy will be any different then a normal pregnancy. I mean is it a higher risk for miscarriages? Or higher risk for problems during the pregnancy. And also I have heard that because of all of your hormones going crazy while pregnant that it can actually "cure" your Pecos. I was just wondering if anybody else has heard of this.
title: anybody have pcos?
